channel.title: Cisco Intersight Help Center – What's New
channel.description: Recent content in What's New on Cisco Intersight Help Center

item.title: Docs: 2023
item.description:
February

February 23

  • Placeholder

February 16

  • Added support for Encryption Key management in IPMI Over LAN Policy on C-Series Intersight Managed Mode servers. For more information, see the Creating an IPMI Over LAN Policy section in the Cisco Intersight Managed Mode Configuration Guide.

February 9

  • Added OS installation support for Red Hat Enterprise Linux (RHEL) 8.6, 8.7, 9.0, and 9.1 and Ubuntu 22.04 LTS on UCS C-Series Standalone and Intersight Managed Mode servers. For more information, see Supported Operating Systems for Standalone Servers and Supported Operating Systems for Intersight Managed Mode Servers.

February 2

  • Cisco UCS Tools VIB Version 1.3.1-1OEM release includes support for VMware ESXi version 8.0 and is available for download on cisco.com. For more information, see Cisco UCS Tools.

  • Added support for HyperFlex Data Platform version 5.0(2b) for B200 M6 compute node support. For more information, see Cisco HyperFlex Cluster Deployment and Expand Cisco HyperFlex Clusters in Cisco Intersight.

  • Added API support in Intersight Workload Optimizer (IWO). For more information, see the Cisco IWO API documentation.

January

January 19

  • Added support for creating orchestration tasks by importing an OpenAPI 3.x specification file. For more information, see Creating Orchestration Tasks from OpenAPI Specifications File.

  • Added support for OS Installation on remote Storage Area Network LUN targets in C-Series Standalone and all Intersight Managed Mode servers. For more information, see Install Target Selection.

  • Added support for UCS-IOM-2304 and UCS-IOM-2304V2 with Cisco UCS 6536 Fabric Interconnect. For more information, see Supported Hardware for Intersight Managed Mode.

January 12

  • Added support for the following Graphics Processing Units in Intersight Managed Mode:

    • UCSC-GPU-A16 on Cisco UCS C-Series M6 server

    • UCSC-GPU-A100 on Cisco UCS C-Series M5 and M6 servers

    For more information, see Supported Hardware for Intersight Managed Mode.

  • Added Integrated Systems Administrator and Integrated Systems Operator privileges to manage Integrated Systems. For more information, see Organizations and Roles in Intersight.

  • Added support for NVMe over RDMA over Converged Ethernet V2 (RoCE V2) with ESXi on Cisco UCS VIC 15000 series adapters. For more information, see RDMA Over Converged Ethernet (RoCE).

item.title: Docs: 2022
item.description:
December 8

  • Added support for Cisco UCS VIC 1300 Series adapters on Cisco UCS B-Series and C-Series M5 servers in Intersight Managed Mode. For more information, see Supported Hardware for Intersight Managed Mode and Creating a LAN Connectivity Policy in Supported UCS Server Policies.

December 1

  • Introducing Nexus Cloud in Controlled Availability. Contact your account representative to get access.
    For complete list of the new Nexus Cloud features, click here.

  • Added support for node redeployment workflow using Cisco Intersight for HyperFlex clusters. For more information, see HyperFlex Node Redeployment Workflow.

  • Enhanced Hardware Support Manager capability to support VMware vSphere 8.0 and manage firmware upgrade operations on Standalone and Intersight Managed Mode servers from VMware vSphere Life Cycle Manager. For more information, see Managing Firmware using Hardware Support Manager.

  • Enhancements to Intersight Managed Mode:

    • Added the ability to set the default drive state for new disks on M6 servers. For more information, see the Creating a Storage Policy section in Supported UCS Server Policies.

    • Enhanced Port VLAN count to 108000 with VLAN Port Count Optimization Enabled on Cisco UCS 6400 Series and 6500 Series Fabric Interconnects. For more information, see the Creating a Switch Control Policy section in Configuring UCS Domain Policies.

  • Enhancements to Intersight Cloud Orchestrator (ICO):

    • Added port channel and virtual port channel management tasks in the ICO Task Library for Cisco Nexus. For more information, see Supported Tasks for Network Targets.

    • Added the ability to view port channels and virtual port channels of Cisco Nexus targets. For more information, see Ethernet Switches Details View.

    • Added User Interface support and inventory object for managing the remote replication in Hitachi storage in Cisco Intersight.

November 19

  • Added support for Oracle database and Azure Billing as new targets, vCPU Scaling Controls, and Maintenance Automation Avoidance in Intersight Workload Optimizer (IWO). For more information, see Intersight Workload Optimizer.

November 10

  • Cisco Intersight User Interface new look is now Generally Available. For more information and help on understanding the changes, see Cisco Intersight New Look.

  • Enhanced the Licensing User Interface in Cisco Intersight. For more information, see License Management.

  • Enhancements to Cisco HyperFlex Systems:

    • HyperFlex Upgrade enhancements:

      • Support for a workflow retry for a failed HyperFlex cluster upgrade. For more information, see Upgrade Cisco HyperFlex Systems in Cisco Intersight.

      • Increased the supported maximum cluster size for upgrade of HyperFlex ESXi clusters from 16 to 32 converged nodes when upgrading to HyperFlex Data Platform version 5.0(2a) or later. For more information, see Upgrade Cisco HyperFlex Systems in Cisco Intersight.

    • iSCSI management on HyperFlex Edge, Fabric Interconnect, and Datacenter without Fabric Interconnect (DC-No-FI) clusters. For more information, see Cisco HyperFlex Systems Administration Guide for Intersight.

    • HyperFlex Expansion recommendation for additional CPU, memory, and storage capacity. This is a Feature Preview. For more information, see HyperFlex Cluster Capacity Planning.

  • Added support for select server actions on Redfish servers. This is a feature preview. For more information, see Redfish Server Target Management in Intersight.

  • Added support for monitoring health and generating alarms for Intersight managed Cisco Nexus devices. For more information, see Ethernet Switches Table View.

  • Added support for monitoring health and reporting alarms for Cisco Nexus devices that are part of the Intersight Integrated Systems. For more information, see Cisco Intersight Integrated Systems.

October 20

  • Added the ability to install SUSE Linux Enterprise Server (SLES) Operating System on UCS C-Series Standalone and Intersight Managed Mode servers. For more information, see Operating System Installation Overview and Installing an Operating System.

October 13

  • Added End of Life (EoL) Advisories for VMware ESXi 6.5/6.7 running on HyperFlex clusters. For more information, see Cisco End of Life Advisories.

  • Enhancements to Intersight Managed Mode:

    • Added the ability to pre-allocate connected device type and device number to a chassis or rack server for Server Port Roles. For more information, see the Creating a Port Policy section in the Cisco Intersight Managed Mode Configuration Guide.

    • Added the ability to configure Private VLANs on a Fabric Interconnect and to apply them on the vNICs of server profiles. For more information, see the Creating a VLAN Configuration Policy section in the Cisco Intersight Managed Mode Configuration Guide.

October 6

  • Added the ability to manually configure vNICs or VHBAs on the adapters with Simple or Advanced Placement options in LAN Connectivity and SAN Connectivity Policies, on Intersight Managed Mode servers. For more information, see Creating a LAN Connectivity Policy and Creating a SAN Connectivity Policy sections in the Cisco Intersight Managed Mode Configuration Guide.

  • Added support for HyperFlex NIC-based deployment starting with HXDP version 5.0(2a) for HX Edge and DC-No-FI clusters. For more information, see Cisco HyperFlex Cluster Deployment.

September 30

  • Added the ability for Intersight to collect user session recording data to optimize customer experience, proactively fix bugs, and improve the product. For more information, see User Session Recording.

September 29

  • Added the ability to create, using API, reserved identifiers for Fabric Interconnect-attached servers and to view and delete them in Intersight. For more information, see Reserved Identifiers.

  • Added support for Tomcat, WebSphere, and Java Virtual Machine as new cloud targets in Intersight Workload Optimizer. For more information, see Cisco Intersight Workload Optimizer Target Configuration Guide under Intersight Workload Optimizer.

September 22

  • Introducing the new look for the Intersight User Interface available to try at Welcome to Intersight. This is a feature preview. For more information, see Cisco Intersight New Look.

  • Enhancements to Intersight Managed Mode:

    • Added the ability to clear or reset Trusted Platform Module (TPM) configuration using the TPM Clear option. For more information, see Server Inventory View.

    • Added the ability to view the power consumption telemetry data for Cisco UCS X-Series servers. For more information, see Server Details View.

September 15

  • Enhancements to Cisco HyperFlex Systems:

    • Added HyperFlex Data Platform 4.5(2e) support for HyperFlex cluster deployment and upgrade. For more information, see Cisco HyperFlex Cluster Deployment and Upgrade Cisco HyperFlex Systems in Cisco Intersight.

    • Added Dynamic Cause and Resolution information specific to the node environment accessible at the Health Check level. For more information, see Health Check for Cisco HyperFlex Clusters.

    • Added new Security Checks with Cause and Resolution information for HyperFlex health check. For more information, see Health Check for Cisco HyperFlex Clusters.

  • New features and enhancements to Intersight Cloud Orchestrator (ICO):

    • Added Syslog and SNMP server management tasks in the ICO Task Library for Cisco Nexus and Cisco MDS targets. For more information, see Supported Tasks for Network Targets.

    • Added the ability to view SNMP and Syslog server details for Cisco Nexus and Cisco MDS targets. For more information, see Ethernet Switches Details View and SAN Switches Details View.

    • Added Pure storage tasks for creating and managing snapshots. For more information, see Supported Tasks for Storage Targets.

    • Added REST API 2.x support for Pure Storage FlashArray. For more information, see Supported Systems.

  • Added the ability for an account admin to collect tech support bundles from the Intersight application. For more information, see Server Actions, Chassis Actions, and Fabric Interconnect Actions.

September 8

  • Enhancements to Cisco Intersight with NetApp ONTAP storage:

    • Added the ability to view the configurations of a NetApp storage system on the Checks tab under the Storage UI section.

    • Enhancements to NetApp storage views under the Storage UI section.

September 1

  • Added HyperFlex Data Platform 5.0(2a) support for HyperFlex cluster deployment and upgrade including:

    • Cisco HyperFlex HX245C/225C M6 All Flash/Hybrid Server nodes support.

    • Support for ESXi 7.0 U3—HXDP 5.0(2a) provides support for VMware ESXi 7.0 U3.

    • Software Encryption support on HyperFlex stretch cluster.

      For more information, see Cisco HyperFlex Cluster Deployment and Upgrade Cisco HyperFlex Systems in Cisco Intersight.

August 25

  • Added Logical Availability Zones (LAZ) support for HyperFlex cluster deployment and expansion in Datacenter without Fabric Interconnect (DC-no-FI) mode with 8 or more nodes. For more information, see DC-No-FI Overview.

  • Enhancements to Intersight Kubernetes Service (IKS):

    • Support for Kubernetes 1.22. For more information, see Intersight Kubernetes Service Feature Compatibility Matrix.

    • Support for running the Intersight Device Connector inside IKS clusters on vSphere.

    • Support for configuring proxy connection to Intersight using the Device Connector Proxy policy. For more information, see HTTP Proxy policy.

    • Updates to the Changelog on new and deprecated features, fixed issues, and important notices.

  • Added the ability to configure Cisco ID using Cisco Software Download services for Cisco Repository-based firmware upgrades. For more information, see Cisco Software Download.

August 11

  • Enhancements to OS Installation for UCS C-Series Standalone and Intersight Managed Mode servers:

    • Added support for Unified Extensible Firmware Interface (UEFI) Secure Boot.

    • Added support for ESXi 7.0 Update 3 and RHEL 8.5 OS.

    • Added support for Ubuntu 20.04.1 LTS, 20.04.2 LTS, 20.04.3 LTS, and 20.04.4 LTS OS.

    For more information, see OS Installation with UEFI Secure Boot, Supported Operating Systems for Standalone Servers, and Supported Operating Systems for Intersight Managed Mode Servers.

  • Added the ability to configure static pin groups for breakout ports in Cisco UCS 6400 and 6500 Series Fabric Interconnects. For more information, see the Creating a Port Policy section in Configuring UCS Domain Policies.

  • Added DNS and NTP tasks in the ICO Task Library for Cisco Nexus targets. For more information, see Supported Tasks for Network Targets.

  • Added the ability to view L2 neighbor details for Cisco Nexus targets. For more information, see Ethernet Switches Details View.

  • Added support for Interoperability compliance (Cisco UCS HCL and NetApp IMT) for FlexPod integrated system. For more information, see Cisco Intersight Integrated Systems.

  • Added support for Google Cloud Platform as a new cloud target in Intersight Workload Optimizer. For more information, see the Google Cloud Platform section in the IWO Target Configuration Guide.

August 4

  • Added support for monitoring select Dell PowerEdge and HPE ProLiant servers as Redfish servers. This is a feature preview. For more information, see Redfish Server Target Management in Intersight.

  • Added support for viewing the undeployed changes in UCS Domain Profiles. For more information, see Domain Profile.

  • Added Inventory, Health Monitoring, and Online Insertion and Removal support for the following Graphics Processing Units on UCS X440P with UCSX-210C-M6 servers:

    • UCSX-GPU-T4-16

    • UCSX-GPU-A40

    • UCSX-GPU-A100-80

    • UCSX-GPU-A16

    For more information, see Supported Systems for Intersight Managed Mode.

  • Enhancements to Cisco Intersight with NetApp ONTAP storage:

    • Added new NetApp storage tasks in the Intersight Cloud Orchestrator task library.

    • Enhancements to NetApp storage views under the Storage UI section.

    For more information, see Supported Tasks for Storage Targets.

August 2

  • New features and enhancements to Intersight Workload Optimizer (IWO):

    • Support for AWS EC2 C6a instances.

    • Support for Azure SQL Databases managed under the vCore pricing model.

    • Support for Instance Store Aware Scaling for Azure VMs to ensure cloud scaling actions respect instance store requirements.

    • IWO now adds injected sidecars to a new group called "Injected Sidecars/All ContainerSpecs".

    • VMs can now be filtered by target name, type, or category when you use Search or create groups.

    For more information, see Cisco Intersight Workload Optimizer.

July 28

  • Enhancements to Cisco HyperFlex Systems:

    • Added HyperFlex Data Platform 4.5(2d) support for HyperFlex cluster deployment and upgrade. For more information, see Cisco HyperFlex Systems Installation Guide for Intersight and Upgrade Cisco HyperFlex Systems in Intersight.

    • Added Datacenter without Fabric Interconnect (DC-No-FI) HyperFlex cluster support with 3-12 nodes. Added NVMe cache in All Flash models, All NVMe server models, and 40/100 GE Networking support with DC-No-FI HyperFlex clusters, new workflow for DC-No-FI install, and compute only node support. For more information, see DC-No-FI Overview.

  • Enhanced Hardware Support Manager capability to manage firmware upgrade operations on Intersight Managed Mode servers from VMware vSphere Life Cycle Manager. For more information, see Claim Targets Using VMware vCenter and Managing Firmware using Hardware Support Manager.

July 21

  • Enhancements to Intersight Managed Mode:

    • Added configuration and inventory support for Cisco UCS 6536 Fabric Interconnect. For more information, see Migrating to Cisco UCS 6500 Series Fabric Interconnects.

    • Added the capability for 100-Gbps end-to-end support with the following:

      • UCS-FI-6536 Fabric Interconnect

      • UCSX-I-9108-100G Intelligent Fabric Module (IFM)

      • UCSX-ML-V5D200G modular LAN on motherboard (mLOM) adapter for Cisco UCS X210 Compute Node

    • Added the following Graphics Processing Units (GPU) for UCSX-210C-M6 servers:

      • Inventory and Online Insertion and Removal (OIR) support for UCS X210C server Compute Node Front Mezz (UCSX-X10C-GPUFM).

      • Inventory, Health Monitoring, and OIR support for NVIDIA T4 GPU (UCSX-GPU-T4-MEZZ).

      For more information, see Supported Systems for Intersight Managed Mode.

    • Added the ability to configure breakout ports for Cisco UCS 6400 Series and 6500 Series Fabric Interconnects. For more information, see Creating a Port Policy section in Configuring UCS Domain Policies.

    • Extended Drift Detection and Remediation to server profiles deployed on the Fabric Interconnect-attached servers. For more information, see the Server Profiles Drift section in Server Profiles.

July 14

  • Cisco Intersight Integrated Systems management capabilities are now Generally Available. These features enable the management of FlexPod environment as an integrated system that consists of a single management control plane for the underlying compute, network, storage, and virtualization resources. For more information, see Cisco Intersight Integrated Systems.

  • Support for managing Cisco UCS C890 M5 targets in Intersight is now Generally Available. For more information, see Managing Cisco UCS C890 M5 Targets.

  • New features and enhancements to Intersight Cloud Orchestrator:

    • Enhanced the ICO Task Library to list the Network tasks based on device types. For more information, see Supported Tasks for Network Targets.

    • Added new Hitachi storage tasks in the ICO Task Library to create and manage snapshots. For more information, see Supported Tasks for Storage Targets.

    • Added the ability to view NTP details for Cisco Nexus targets. For more information, see Ethernet Switches Details View.

July 7

  • Added VLAN management tasks in the ICO Task Library for Cisco Nexus targets. For more information, see Supported Tasks for Network Targets.

  • Added the ability to view VLAN inventory for Cisco Nexus targets. For more information, see Ethernet Switches Details View.

  • Added VSAN management tasks in the ICO Task Library for Cisco MDS targets. For more information, see Supported Tasks for Network Targets.

  • Added the ability to view VSAN inventory for Cisco MDS targets. For more information, see SAN Switches Details View.

June 30

  • Added the ability to view FC port neighbor details of Cisco MDS targets. This is a feature preview. For more information, see SAN Switches Details View.

June 16

  • Added the ability to create an FC Zone Policy containing direct access storage paths configuration, and attach this policy to a vHBA to provision zones for the vHBA. For more information, see Create an FC Zone Policy and Creating a SAN Connectivity policy sections in the Cisco Intersight Managed Mode Configuration Guide.

June 8

  • Added HyperFlex Data Platform 5.0(1c) support for HyperFlex cluster deployment and upgrade. For more information, see Cisco HyperFlex Systems Installation Guide for Intersight and Upgrade Cisco HyperFlex Systems in Intersight.

May 26

  • Added the ability to enable Hardware Support Manager (HSM) in VMware vCenter targets. HSM provides the capability to manage firmware upgrade operations on Cisco UCS C-Series Standalone servers from VMware vCenter Life Cycle Manager (vLCM). For more information, see Claim Targets and Managing Firmware using Hardware Support Manager.

May 19

  • Added the ability to configure rack server and chassis IDs on recommission. For more information, see Servers Table View and Chassis Table View.

  • New features and enhancements to Intersight Cloud Orchestrator:

    • Added the following tasks to manage Cisco MDS targets:

      • Set DNS Server

      • Remove DNS Server

      • Set NTP Server

      • Remove NTP Server

      This is a feature preview. For more information, see Supported Tasks for Network Targets.

    • Added the ability to view DNS and NTP server details of Cisco MDS targets. This is a feature preview. For more information, see SAN Switches Details View.

    • Added the ability to view the features and the licenses of Cisco Nexus targets. This is a feature preview. For more information, see Ethernet Switches Details View.

May 12

  • Added support for NVMe cache in All Flash models, All NVMe hardware models, and 40/100 GE Networking with DC-no-FI HyperFlex clusters. For more information, see HyperFlex DC-no-FI Deployment.

May 5

  • Spring Framework fix is now available in Intersight. For more information, see Cisco Security Advisory for Spring Framework.

  • Enhancements to Cisco Intersight Workload Optimizer:

    • Application Performance Management—Added the capability to use percentile calculations for AppDynamics.

    • Cloud Resource Management—Added the ability to view cost breakdown by Tag Chart.

    • On-Prem Resource Management—Improved actions detail for virtual machines and added support for NetApp ONTAP 9.

    • Container Platform Management—Added the capability to obtain resizing recommendations. Added the ability to manually execute actions for Azure Kubernetes Service.

    For more information, see Intersight Workload Optimizer Target Configuration Guide and Intersight Workload Optimizer User Guide.

  • Added the ability to send real-time notifications using webhooks when events occur within the local Intersight environment. For more information, see Configuring Webhooks.

April 28

  • Enhancements to Cisco HyperFlex Systems:

    • Added the capability to manage encrypted datastores in Intersight. For more information, see Manage Datastores.

    • Added support to expand HyperFlex clusters with M6 HyperFlex nodes. For more information, see Expand Cisco HyperFlex Clusters in Intersight.

  • Added the ability to change the type of an AWS virtual machine instance in Intersight Virtualization Service. For more information, see Resizing an AWS Virtual Machine Instance.

  • Added new NetApp Smart LUN storage tasks in the Intersight Cloud Orchestrator task library. For more information, see Supported Tasks for Storage Targets.

  • Added the ability to view the power state telemetry data for UCS servers. For more information, see Servers Details View.

April 21

  • Enhanced sort and filter capability for additional columns in the Servers Table View including HCL Status, Contract Status, and more. For more information, see Servers Table View.

  • Added HyperFlex Data Platform 4.5(2c) support for HyperFlex cluster deployment and upgrade. For more information, see Cisco HyperFlex Cluster Deployment and Upgrade Cisco HyperFlex Systems in Intersight.

  • New features and enhancements to Intersight Cloud Orchestrator:

    • Added new tasks to manage the Cisco Nexus and MDS targets available in Cisco Intersight. This is a feature preview. For more information, see Supported Tasks for Network Targets.

    • Added the ability to view ports of Cisco Nexus and MDS targets, and port channels of Cisco MDS targets. This is a feature preview. For more information, see Ethernet Switches Table View and SAN Switches Table View.

    • Added the Serial Loop task to iteratively run tasks based on a specified count or condition. For more information, see Operations – Serial Loop Task.

    • Added the ability to enable automatic rollback of a workflow when the workflow execution fails. For more information, see Defining a Workflow.

    • Added the ability to support Cisco UCS Director as one of the endpoints for the Invoke Web API task. For more information, see Executors - Invoke Web API Request.

    • Added support for custom mode of installation in the OS installation workflow. For more information, see Adding an OS Installation Workflow to Workflow Designer.

  • Enhancements to Cisco Intersight with NetApp ONTAP storage:

    • Enhancements to NetApp storage views under the Storage UI section.

    • Added new NetApp storage tasks in the Intersight Cloud Orchestrator task library.

    For more information, see Supported Tasks for Storage Targets.

April 14

  • Enhancements to Cisco Intersight Workload Optimizer (IWO):

    • Added support to manage Microsoft SQL Server and My SQL Server targets in IWO.

    • Added the ability to dynamically adjust the number of pod replicas for horizontally scalable Kubernetes services.

    • Added support for the new AWS M6i family of instances and improved cost calculations for AWS.

    • Added support for Azure Dv5-series and Ev5-series instance types.

    For more information, see Intersight Workload Optimizer Target Configuration Guide and Intersight Workload Optimizer User Guide.

  • Added the ability to log in to Intersight using Account Name URL, as well as add and verify Domain Names, which can then be added to IdPs. For more information, see Configuring Account Settings and Single Sign-on with Intersight.

  • Added the ability to configure static pin groups for managing Ethernet and Fibre Channel traffic in Intersight Managed Mode servers. For more information, see the Creating a Port Policy section in the Cisco Intersight Managed Mode Configuration Guide.

April 7

  • Added the ability in HyperFlex Cluster Device Connector to view connectivity details and help remediate issues. For more information, see Configuring Device Connector.

  • Added support for HashiCorp Configuration Language variables and downloading Terraform state version contents. For more information, see Configuring Intersight Services for Hashicorp Terraform.

March 24

  • Added the ability to claim Cisco MDS and Nexus switch endpoint targets, and view the inventory information. This is a feature preview. For more information, see Claim Targets, Ethernet Switches Table View, and SAN Switches Table View.

  • Added the following privileges:

    • Network Administrator and Network Operator to support Cisco Nexus endpoints.

    • SAN Administrator and SAN Operator to support Cisco MDS endpoints.

    • For more information, see Organizations and Roles in Intersight.

  • Enhancements to Intersight Kubernetes Service (IKS):

    • Support for Kubernetes 1.21 in IKS using ContainerD CRI. For more information, see Intersight Kubernetes Service Feature Compatibility Matrix.

    • Support for Cisco Intersight Service Mesh Manager 1.8.2. For more information, see Cisco Intersight Service Mesh Manager.

    • For more information on new or deprecated features, enhancements, and issues in IKS, see Changelog.

March 10

  • Enhancements to Cisco HyperFlex Systems:

    • Added the ability to upgrade server firmware for HyperFlex Fabric Interconnect-attached clusters. For more information, see Upgrade Cisco HyperFlex Systems in Intersight.

    • Added the ability to expand HyperFlex 2-Node Edge clusters. For more information, see Expand Cisco HyperFlex Clusters in Intersight.

  • Added the ability to launch vKVM on all servers in UCSM Managed Mode without the need for secondary authentication with UCS Manager. For more information, see Launch Virtual KVM.

  • Added the following capabilities for Hitachi storage in Intersight Cloud Orchestrator:

    • Find Storage Volume by ID task. For more information, see Task Designer.

    • Remove or Update VMFS Datastore workflows. For more information, see Workflow Designer.

March 3

  • Added support for the following features for Cisco UCS C890 M5 Rack Server Management:

    • General Server Actions

    • Inventory and Alarms

    • vKVM Launch

    • Integration with Cisco TAC

    • Managing Foreign Drive Configurations

    • Setting Disk State

    • Virtual Disk Management

    • Trusted Platform Module Support

    For more information, see Managing Cisco UCS C890 M5 Targets.

February 17

  • Added the ability to view EC2 inventory for Amazon Web Services and perform power operations on EC2 virtual machines. For more information, see Virtualization Service.

  • Added support in Intersight Cloud Orchestrator to create variables for a workflow. For more information, see Workflow Variables.

February 10

  • Added the ability to configure and launch Tunneled vKVM on all servers in Intersight Managed Mode. For more information, see Creating a Virtual KVM Policy.

  • Added new tasks for VMware vCenter networking operations to manage distributed virtual switches and distributed virtual networks. For more information, see Task Designer.

  • Added new tasks for managing networks and assigning IP addresses to the virtual machines. For more information, see Task Designer.

February 3

  • Enhancements to Device Contract Coverage widgets to include:

    • Enhanced view of devices with contract status now allows up to three device types.

    • Ability to view and export contract status details from the Device Contract Coverage page.

    For more information, see Contract Status Widgets.

  • Added a new task for UCS C-Series standalone and Intersight Managed Mode servers in the workflow designer to create server profiles from templates. For more information, see Compute Tasks Matrix.

  • Added support for Kubernetes 1.20 in Intersight Kubernetes Service. For more information, see Intersight Kubernetes Service Feature Compatibility Matrix.

  • Enhanced chassis and server power policies by adding support for Power Save Mode, Dynamic Power Rebalancing and setting the Power Priority. For more information, see Creating a Power Policy for Chassis and Creating a Power Policy for Server.

January 27

  • Added HyperFlex Data Platform 5.0(1b) support for HyperFlex cluster deployment and upgrade. For more information, see Cisco HyperFlex Systems Installation Guide for Intersight and Upgrade Cisco HyperFlex Systems in Intersight.

  • Added capability to configure Software encryption on ESXi-based HyperFlex Edge clusters and Fabric Interconnect clusters:

    • Ability to manage keys natively in Intersight with Intersight Key Manager.

    • Ability to re-key and validate encryption keys.

    For more information, see HyperFlex Software Encryption.

  • Added capability to protect encrypted datastores with N:1 Replication. For more information, see N:1 Replication for Cisco HyperFlex Clusters.

  • Enhancements to Cisco Intersight with NetApp ONTAP storage:

    • Added Intersight alarms for events generated from NetApp Active IQ Unified Manager. This support is applicable from Active IQ Unified Manager 9.10 or later releases.

    • Added storage VM and volume details in the Storage Inventory page.

  • Added Graphical View support for Cisco UCS S3260 servers in standalone mode. For more information, see Servers Details View.

January 20

  • Enhancements to status.intersight.com page:

    • Enhanced classification and categorization of Intersight services.

    • Added Slack subscription option for notification of Intersight status updates.

    • Added capability to get Intersight status updates for specific components.

    For more information, see Intersight Status Page.

  • Added workflow tasks for claiming, getting target details, and removing SSH, Ansible, PowerShell, and HTTP endpoint targets in Intersight. For more information, see Supported Target Management Tasks.

  • Added support for a graceful termination of firmware upgrade in standalone servers. For more information, see Managing Firmware in Standalone Mode.

  • Added new Cisco Security Advisories. For a complete list of advisories and more information, see Intersight Advisories.

January 13

  • Enhancements to Cisco HyperFlex Systems:

    • Added ability to view hosts, virtual machines, and drives.

    • Added capability to view, create, and manage datastores and storage containers.

      • For more information, see Cisco HyperFlex Systems Administration Guide.

    • Added ability to open a TAC case directly from the HyperFlex Clusters table view. For more information, see Integration with Cisco TAC.

  • Enhancements to Intersight Cloud Orchestrator (ICO):

    • Added ability to create reusable tasks to invoke Ansible Playbook and SSH commands to automate operations on the target devices. For more information, see Executors – Invoke Ansible Playbook - Reusable Task and Executors – Invoke SSH Commands - Reusable Task.

    • Added support for key-based authentication for SSH and Ansible target devices. For more information, see Claim Targets.

January 6

  • Enhancements to Cisco Intersight Workload Optimizer (IWO):

    • Added ability to perform multiple Azure volume actions together on a single VM.

    • Added capability to recommend scaling actions for AWS RDS database servers.

    • Added capability to run Buy VM Reservation plan for Cloud Resource Management to view RI purchase opportunities.

    • Added capability to discover the app services and plans for Azure App deployment.

    • Added capability to analyze on-premises volumes and ability to view blade servers as hosts in a datacenter for on-premises Resource Management.

    • Improved Savings and Investments charts, Top Accounts chart, and improvements for AWS and Azure targets.

    For more information, see Intersight Workload Optimizer Target Configuration Guide and Intersight Workload Optimizer User Guide.

item.title: Docs: 2021
item.description:
December 20

  • Log4j fix is now available in Intersight. For more information, see Cisco Security Advisory for Apache Log4j

December 9

  • Enhancements to Cisco HyperFlex Systems in Intersight:

    • Added HyperFlex Data Platform 4.5(2b) support for HyperFlex cluster deployment and upgrade. For more information, see Cisco HyperFlex Systems Installation Guide for Intersight and Upgrade Cisco HyperFlex Systems in Intersight

    • Added capability to alert users about End of Life and End of Support dates for Cisco HyperFlex Data Platform software releases that are no longer supported. For more information, see Cisco End of Life Advisories

  • Enhancements to Intersight Cloud Orchestrator (ICO):

    • Added ability to execute PowerShell scripts using Invoke PowerShell Script tasks to automate operations on the PowerShell target endpoints. For more information, see Executors – Invoke PowerShell Script

    • Added ability to support Cisco Application Policy Infrastructure Controller (APIC) as one of the target endpoints in Invoke Web API task. For more information, see Executors - Invoke Web API Request

  • Added support for launching VMware ESXi host console. For more information, see General Information on Hosts

  • Added support for VMware ESXi host maintenance mode actions. For more information, see General Information on Hosts

  • Added OS Installation support for Windows 2022 and RHEL 8.4 for standalone and Intersight Managed Mode (IMM) servers. For more information, see Supported Operating Systems for Standalone Servers and Supported Operating Systems for Intersight Managed Mode Servers

  • Added support for Image Views and Health Overlay on the UCSM Managed Mode (UMM) Fabric Interconnects Details View. For more information, see Fabric Interconnects Details View

  • Added support for specifying the switching mode for Ethernet and Fibre Channel ports. For more information, see Creating a Switch Control Policy

  • Added support for specifying the VSAN scope of an FC port and for specifying the role of the FC port as FC Storage or FC Uplink. For more information, see Creating a Port Policy and Creating a VSAN Configuration Policy

  • Added the ability to configure Out-Of-Band IP addresses to route traffic using the management port of the Fabric Interconnect. For more information, see Creating an IMC Access Policy

  • Ability to enable the Get Subscription Information option to obtain subscription details such as usage, status, and expiration date to be displayed on the Licensing page. For more information, see Registering Intersight with Cisco Smart Licensing

  • Added IKS licensing support (Trial and Advantage) for clusters running on VMware, which will report vCPU usage of IKS clusters running on VMware. For more information, see Cisco Intersight Kubernetes Service Licensing

December 2

  • The Cisco Intersight Service Mesh Manager (Intersight SMM) extension, a managed Istio offering, is now Generally Available. Intersight SMM enables you to observe, inspect, and manage application traffic, control the ingress/egress gateways, and use policy-based secure connectivity. For more information, see Cisco Intersight Service Mesh Manager

  • Enhancements for the Add Terraform Workspace workflow selections including Execution Mode, Apply Method, User Interface, and Share State Globally. For more information, see Terraform Service enhancements for the Add Terraform Workspace workflow

  • Added Parallel Loop task in Intersight Cloud Orchestrator (ICO) to iteratively run a single task or sub-workflow based on the specified count. For more information, see Operations - Parallel Loop Task

November 19

  • Enhancements for standalone and Intersight Managed Mode (IMM) servers:

    • Added network device and VLAN ID configuration support in Cisco Mode of OS Installation. For more information, see Performing OS Installation in Cisco mode

    • Added ability to reset vKVM. For more information, see Server Actions and Supported Virtual KVM

  • Added new targets to support target claim, using Resource Groups, for the Organization. For more information, see Target Claim for Compute/Fabric, Hyperconverged, Orchestrator, and Platform Services Targets

  • Enhancements to Intersight Cloud Orchestrator (ICO):

    • Added tasks for creating and managing virtual machine templates

    • Added support for viewing virtual machine template inventory.

      • For more information, see General Information on Virtual Machine Templates

  • Enhancements to Cisco Intersight Workload Optimizer (IWO):

    • Added ability to recommend scale actions for Azure VMs based on the number of NICs supported by an Azure pricing tier.

    • Added support for node pools to deploy and scale compute resources for Kubernetes services.

    • Added improvements in cumulative savings and investments charts and actions for Azure resource groups.

    • Added ability to view additional information for container platform actions, services, and vStorage resize actions.

    • Added capability to discover tags assigned to workloads and view them from the Actions Details page for pending actions.

    For more information, see Intersight Workload Optimizer Target Configuration Guide and Intersight Workload Optimizer User Guide

November 12

  • Cisco HyperFlex Data Platform 5.0(1a) release provides the following features in Intersight:

    • Support for install and upgrade of a HyperFlex converged node on HyperFlex-Series M6 servers. You can use HyperFlex-Series M6 servers, as well as compliant UCS C-Series M6 servers, to deploy HyperFlex clusters.

      For more information, see Cisco HyperFlex Systems Installation Guide for Intersight and Upgrade Cisco HyperFlex Systems in Intersight

    • Added ability to take snapshots of virtual machines and restore, using N:1 Replication for HyperFlex Clusters in Intersight:

      • Ability to configure different retention counts on the source and target clusters.

      • Ability to use HyperFlex Fabric Interconnected clusters as source clusters.

      • Backup dashboard enhancements to include error reporting for failed snapshots and replication, drill down options, and consolidated view of failed backups and restores in the last 24 hours.

      For more information, see N:1 Replication for HyperFlex Clusters

  • Added Non-Volatile Memory Express (NVMe) configuration support in Boot Order policy for standalone and Intersight Managed Mode (IMM) servers. For more information, see Boot Order Policy

  • Added embedded tasks in Intersight Cloud Orchestrator (ICO) to invoke Ansible Playbook and SSH commands to automate operations on the target devices. For more information, see Executors - Invoke Ansible Playbook and Executors - Invoke SSH Commands

October 28

  • Added support to integrate Cisco Intersight Workload Optimizer (IWO) with ServiceNow for change management of actions and recommendations. For more information, see Intersight Workload Optimizer Target Configuration Guide and Intersight Workload Optimizer User Guide

  • Added support for the configuration of Disjoint Layer 2 VLANs on UCS Fabric Interconnect uplink ports. For more information, see Creating a VLAN Configuration Policy

  • Enhancements to Intersight Kubernetes Service (IKS):

    • Added support for the Service Mesh Manager (SMM) add-on. This is a feature preview. For more information, see Service Mesh Manager for IKS

    • Added support for deleting cluster profiles using Intersight API.

October 22

  • Enhancements to Cisco Intersight with NetApp ONTAP storage:

    • Added Health status information to Storage General page

    • Enhanced Storage Inventory page to include:

      • NTP Server details

      • Sensor details which include PSU, FRU, and Fan details for each Node

      • CIFS and NVMe information for Storage Virtual Machines

      • Latency, IOPS, and Throughput statistics for Volumes, LUNs, VMs, Aggregates, and Nodes

      • Total Data Capacity details for Volumes

      • VLAN and link aggregation details for Ports

October 14

  • Enhancements to Cisco Intersight Workload Optimizer (IWO):

    • Added support to manage New Relic target.

    • Added ability to collect Guest Metrics from vCenter targets.

      • For more information, see Intersight Workload Optimizer Target Configuration Guide and Intersight Workload Optimizer User Guide

  • Added tasks for mounting and connecting external datastores on the ESXi hosts via iSCSI software adapters.

  • Added support for Cisco UCS C225 M6 server in Standalone mode and in Intersight Managed Mode (IMM). For more information, see Supported Systems

October 7

  • Enhancements to Intersight Service for Terraform (IST):

    • Added workflow to create a workspace in Terraform Cloud.

    • Added rollback option for Add Terraform Variables workflow.

    • Added an option to destroy plan (destroy existing infrastructure managed by Terraform) to Start New Terraform Plan workflow.

      • For more information, see TFC-ICO Integration: Out-of-Box ICO Workflows

  • Enhancements to Server Profile management:

    • Added Resource Pools to group homogeneous resources and automate configuration of Cisco UCS Standalone and Fabric Interconnect-attached servers. For more information, see Resource Pools and Configuring Server Profiles

    • Added support for Universally Unique Identifier (UUID) pools and UUID static address on Fabric Interconnect-attached servers. For more information, see UUID Pools and Configuring Server Profiles

  • Added tasks for creating and managing storage pools in the storage targets available in Intersight. For more information, see Supported Tasks for Storage Targets

  • Added capability to define Parameter Set and Progressive Disclosure rules for workflow inputs. For more information, see Workflow Input Parameter Set and Progressive Disclosure Rules

  • Added capability to define Parameter Set rules for composite data types. For more information, see Data Type Parameter Set Rule

October 5

  • Enhancements to Cisco Intersight Workload Optimizer (IWO):

    • Improved Container Resource Management for Kubernetes CPU Metrics and Kubernetes Node Actions.

    • Improved Cloud Resource Management to include uptime data in cost calculations for cloud VMs, cumulative savings and cumulative investments charts, and AWS Savings plans utilization and coverage.

    • Added recommendation in Container Resize Action to increase the vCPU limit capacity for addressing slow response times associated with CPU throttling.

      • For more information, see Intersight Workload Optimizer Target Configuration Guide and Intersight Workload Optimizer User Guide

September 30

  • Added the ability to configure the timezone for Standalone servers. For more information, see Creating an NTP Policy

September 24

  • Added the ability to configure a retention period for audit logs as part of account settings configuration. For more information, see Account Settings Configuration​

  • Enhanced Intersight Target Claim:

    • Added Resource Group to classify and manage resources for Organizations. For more information, see Creating a Resource Group

    • Added Device Administrator and Device Technician privileges to support Organization user role. For more information, see Creating a User Defined role

September 16

  • Support for Cisco UCS X-series in Intersight Managed Mode (IMM) is now Generally Available. For more information, see Supported Systems​ and Chassis Inventory View

  • Added support for managing Cisco UCS C890 M5 targets in Intersight. This is a feature preview. For more information, see Managing Cisco UCS C890 M5 Targets​

  • Enhancements to Intersight Cloud Orchestrator (ICO):

    • Added support for exporting and importing workflows, tasks, and data types from one account to another. For more information, see Workflow Designer, Task Designer, and Data Types

    • Added support for viewing execution graph after the successful execution of user-defined workflows. For more information, see Workflow Designer

    • Added new tasks for creating and managing virtual machine snapshots. For more information, see General Information on Virtual Machines

    • Added new tasks for creating and managing VMware datastore clusters associated with VMware vCenter devices such as datacenters, datastores, virtual machines, and host.

    • Added support for cloning Orchestration tasks. For more information, see Task Designer

September 9

  • Automated generation of TAC Service Request and Return Material Authorization from Intersight, is now Generally Available. For more information, see Enabling Proactive Support through Intersight​

  • Cisco Hardware Compatibility List (HCL) to determine hardware compliance is available for Cisco UCS C245 M6 and C225 M6 servers in Standalone Mode. For more information, see Compliance with Hardware Compatibility List (HCL)​

  • Added support for viewing virtual machine snapshot inventory. For more information, see General Information on Virtual Machines

  • Added new Cisco Security Advisories. For a complete list of advisories and more information, see Intersight Advisories

September 2

  • Added ability to select and view the location information of VMware datastore clusters associated with VMware vCenter devices such as datacenters, datastores, virtual machines, and host. For more information, see General Information on Datastore Clusters

  • Added support for managing the inventory information of VMware datastore clusters. For more information, see General Information on Datastore Clusters

  • Enhanced UI for Task Input and Rollback Task Input mappings in Task Designer. For more information, see Task Designer

  • Added new Cisco Security Advisories. For a complete list of advisories and more information, see Intersight Advisories

August 26

  • Enhanced Storage Policy to simplify storage configuration. For more information, see Creating a Storage Policy

  • Added support for Cisco UCS C245 M6 server in Intersight Managed Mode (IMM). For more information, see Supported Systems

  • Added support for Cisco UCS C220 M6, C240 M6, and B200 M6 servers in UCSM Managed Mode (UMM). For more information, see Supported Systems

  • Added support for operating system installation for Cisco UCS C245 M6 server in Intersight Managed Mode (IMM). For more information, see Operating System Installation Overview

  • Cisco Hardware Compatibility List (HCL) to determine hardware compliance is available for:

    • Cisco UCS C245 M6 server in Standalone and in Intersight Managed Mode (IMM)

    • Cisco UCS C220 M6, C240 M6, and B200 M6 servers in UCSM Managed Mode (UMM)

    For more information, see Compliance with Hardware Compatibility List (HCL)

  • Added ability to support vCenter as one of the endpoints in Invoke Web API task. For more information, see Executors - Invoke Web API Request

August 19

  • Added capability to run HyperFlex health checks for network retransmits, and ability to validate the disk state, DNS latency, keystore file consistency, and ESXi HyperFlex user password on HyperFlex clusters. For more information, see Health Check for HyperFlex Clusters

  • Added support for operating system installation for Cisco UCS C220 M6, C240 M6, and B200 M6 servers in Intersight Managed Mode (IMM). For more information, see Operating System Installation Overview

  • Added support for streamlining replacement of Fabric Interconnects. For more information, see RMA Upgrades and Replacement

  • Added ability to filter dashboards by tags and organizations. Also, added dashboard presets that allow for easier custom dashboard builds. For more information, see Dashboard Management

August 12

  • Added support for HyperFlex cluster expansion for Edge and FI-Attached clusters. For more information, see Expand Cisco HyperFlex Clusters in Intersight

  • Added support for operating system installation for standalone Cisco UCS C-Series M6 servers. For more information, see Supported Operating Systems for Standalone Servers

  • Cisco Hardware Compatibility List (HCL) to determine hardware compliance is available for Cisco UCS C220 M6, C240 M6, and B200 M6 servers. For more information, see Compliance with Hardware Compatibility List (HCL)

  • Enhancements to Intersight managed devices:

    • Intersight Managed Mode features including functionalities such as Policies, Pools, Profiles, and Templates are now Generally Available for Private Virtual Appliance. These features are supported on Intersight Private Virtual Appliance starting with version 1.0.9-302. For more information, see Intersight Managed Mode

    • Added support for Cisco UCS C220 M6, C240 M6, and B200 M6 servers in Intersight Managed Mode. The support is also available on Intersight Virtual Appliance starting with version 1.0.9-302. For more information, see Supported Systems

July 30

  • Added support for Cisco UCS C-Series M6 servers in Standalone mode. For more information, see Supported Systems

  • Added support for streamlining replacement of Fabric Interconnects. For more information, see RMA Upgrades and Replacement

  • Added support for Power and Thermal policies for B-Series chassis. For more information, see Chassis Policies and Server Policies

  • Added support for configuring CA signed certificates on Intersight Managed Mode servers. For more information, see Server Actions

  • Enhancements to Intersight Cloud Orchestrator:

    • Added new tasks for UCS C-Series standalone servers to support precision boot device operations. For more information, see Compute Tasks Matrix

    • Added OS installation workflow to the ICO automation library, which can be included as a part of another comprehensive workflow. For more information, see Installing an Operating System

    • Added support for cloning Orchestration data types. For more information, see Data Types

July 22

  • Added support to lock/unlock the front panel and reset CMOS for IMM servers. For more information, see Server Actions

  • Added support for login using Identity Provider (IdP) initiated SSO, which enables login to Intersight through an IdP user portal, or through an App URL supported by some IdPs. For more information, see Overview of Single Sign-On with Cisco Intersight

  • Added capability to automatically allocate MAC Prefix during HyperFlex cluster profile configuration. For more information, see Cisco HyperFlex Systems Installation Guide for Intersight

  • Cisco Hardware Compatibility List (HCL) to determine hardware compliance is available for Cisco UCS S-Series servers. For more information, see Compliance with Hardware Compatibility List (HCL)

  • Added support for cloning or creating a new version of the existing workflow in workflow designer. For more information, see Workflow Designer

July 15

  • Added capability to run NTP Client Service Status, Package Version, and Stale Node health checks on HyperFlex clusters. For more information, see HyperFlex Health Check

  • Enhanced the Terraform cloud integration by enabling users to add/update the default list of managed hosts for an agent. For more information, see Deploy a Terraform Cloud Agent

July 8

  • Added out-of-box workflows in Intersight Cloud Orchestrator (ICO) which allows users to add/update variables, queue a plan, and approve a run on a Terraform Cloud workspace. For more information, see Intersight Service for Terraform

  • Added ability to update managed hosts and other Terraform Agent properties. For more information, see Deploy a Terraform Cloud Agent

  • Added ability to manage vKVM, Tunneled vKVM, and VMRC console sessions launched from Intersight. For more information, see Managing Sessions

  • Added support to manage Dynatrace and Cloud Foundry targets in Intersight Workload Optimizer (IWO). For more information, see Intersight Workload Optimizer Target Configuration Guide and Intersight Workload Optimizer User Guide

  • Added support to send email notifications for alarms raised in Intersight. For more information, see Configuring Email Notifications

July 1

  • Added support for enabling the Azure Stack QoS capability, GENEVE offload protocol, and selecting FC-NVMe protocol for Intersight Managed Mode servers. For more information, see Creating a LAN Connectivity Policy, Creating an Ethernet Adapter Policy, and Creating a SAN Connectivity Policy

  • Added HyperFlex Data Platform 4.5(2a) support for HyperFlex cluster deployment and upgrade. For more information, see HyperFlex Cluster Management and Upgrading Cisco HyperFlex Systems with Cisco Intersight

June 24

  • Enhancements to Cisco Intersight Workload Optimizer (IWO):

    • Improved AWS Savings Plans and Kubernetes Analytics, ability to identify performance and efficiency opportunities for a single Kubernetes Cluster, and Currency Settings enhancements. For more information, see Intersight Workload Optimizer User Guide

    • Enhancements for Kubernetes pod “Move” actions and the “Number of Replicas” chart. To use this feature, the Kubernetes Collector for Cisco Intersight Workload Optimizer must be updated to the latest version. For more information, see Intersight Workload Optimizer Target Configuration Guide

  • Added ability to select and view the location information of VMware vCenter objects such as datacenters, clusters, datastores, virtual machines, or folders in which the objects reside.

  • Added a single task to support invoke guest customization for VMware vCenter in Workflow Designer for Linux or Windows virtual machines.

>>>>>>> c40a51f58caa9d91bcbb736eef6530f9c840e6b4

June 17

  • Added ability to support Bearer Token authentication scheme in HTTP endpoint target with an optional ability to add endpoint without authentication. For more information, see Executors -Invoke Web API Request

  • Added ability to skip execution of a custom web API task based on the task inputs or previous API outputs. This will skip execution of all the subsequent APIs in the task. For more information, see Task Designer

  • Added a new task for formatting storage volumes in various storage targets available in Intersight. For more information, see Supported Tasks for Storage Targets

June 10

  • Added HyperFlex Data Platform 4.0(2f) support for HyperFlex cluster deployment and upgrade. For more information, see HyperFlex Cluster Management and Upgrading Cisco HyperFlex Systems with Cisco Intersight

  • Added ability to specify Task Status Outcomes in Web API task, which allows customization of task execution status and/or message based on API response. For more information, see Executors -Invoke Web API Request

June 3

  • Added capability to configure the interval and start date for the data used in calculating capacity forecast for HyperFlex clusters. This enables faster replanning and allows known capacity change windows to be skipped from the capacity planning calculation. For more information, see HyperFlex Cluster Capacity Planning

  • Added new tasks for VMware vCenter networking operations to provision and manage vSphere standard switches, distributed virtual switches, and VMkernel networks. For more information, see Workflow Designer

  • Updated support to accommodate recent changes to Cisco ID for Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA). If MFA for your individual Cisco ID user account was enabled before April 16, 2021, you will be asked to re-enable it as part of your next login to Intersight.

May 27

  • Support for NetApp ONTAP storage to simplify management and orchestration of NetApp FlexPod and ONTAP data storage environments is now Generally Available. For more information, see Intersight Cloud Orchestrator and Intersight Assist

  • Added capability to use multiple Intersight Assists in an Intersight Account with Cisco Intersight Workload Optimizer (IWO) service. For more information, see Intersight Workload Optimizer Getting Started Guide

May 20

  • Added ability to perform server and Fabric Interconnect firmware upgrade in UCS Manager Mode for Private Virtual Appliance. For more information, see Managing Firmware in UCS Manager Mode

  • Added support for viewing the network inventory information of VMware vCenter devices such as datacenters, hosts, or virtual machines. For more information, see General Information on Datacenters, General Information on Hosts, and General Information on Virtual Machines

  • Added support to manage Nutanix Hybrid Cloud Platform (HCI) and Nutanix Acropolis (AOS) targets in Cisco Intersight Workload Optimizer (IWO). For more information, see Intersight Workload Optimizer Target Configuration Guide

May 6

  • Cisco Intersight Cloud Orchestrator features are now Generally Available. For more information, see Cisco Intersight Cloud Orchestrator

  • Added support for cloning workflows. For more information, see Workflow Designer

  • Added support to automatically upgrade the HyperFlex compatibility catalog on connected HyperFlex clusters. This capability seamlessly introduces support for new drive models, without requiring a HyperFlex Data Platform upgrade

  • Added ability to filter dashboards by tags and organizations. Also, added dashboard presets that allow for easier custom dashboard builds. For more information, see Dashboard Management

  • Added new Cisco Security Advisories. For a complete list of advisories and more information, see Intersight Advisories

April 29

  • Enhancements to Cisco Intersight Cloud Orchestrator:

    • Added ability to easily retrieve design-time debug logs for the Invoke Web API tasks to achieve easier troubleshooting for workflow designers. For more information, see Workflow Designer
    • Added support to apply data transformation of various types such as string formatting, date time processing, convert data from one format to the other, so that data can be made available between different workflow tasks in the required format. For more information, see Input and Output Mapping
    • Added support for displaying summary dashboards for Workflow Designer, Task Designer, and Data Types tabs. The tabs display user-defined and system-generated workflows, tasks, and data types. For more information, see Workflow Designer Workflow Designer
  • Added Online Insertion and Removal (OIR) support for blade and rack server sub-components, rack server fans and power supply units, chassis enclosure and IOM, chassis and IOM cable changes, and FI and FEX fan and power supply units. For more information, see Online Insertion and Removal
  • Dashboard widget that displays contract status based on the current validity of the service contracts, now includes UCS Chassis and Intersight Managed Mode devices. For more information, see Contract Status Widgets
  • Added the ability to create IPMI users by using the Local User Policy. For more information, see Server Policies
  • Cisco Intersight Service for HashiCorp Terraform Service (IST) features are now Generally Available. For more information, see Intersight Service for HashiCorp Terraform
  • Added new Cisco Field Notices. For a complete list of advisories and more information, see Intersight Advisories

April 22

  • Intersight Managed Mode features are now Generally Available. Enhancements to Intersight managed devices are:

    • Added support for online insertion and removal of servers in a blade chassis and chassis power supply units and fans. The insertion and removal is done transparently and without disrupting other components in the chassis, thereby ensuring better service and platform management.
    • Added support to configure and assign Flow Control, Link Aggregation, and Link Control policies in Intersight Managed domains. For more information, see Domain Policies
    • Added support for monitoring the Hardware Compatibility List (HCL) status on the Intersight Managed Mode (IMM) servers. For more information, see Compliance with Hardware Compatibility List (HCL)

  • Added ability to easily create and manage Server Profiles at scale with Server Profile Templates. For more information, see Server Profile Templates

  • Added ability to deploy operating system configurations to multiple servers using values in a CSV file. For more information, see Uploading CSV Files for Operating System Deployment

  • Added support to show folder details for VMware vCenter objects such as clusters, datacenters, datastores, and virtual machines. For more information, see Viewing Virtualized Objects in Cisco Intersight

  • Added new tasks for UCS C-Series standalone and Intersight Managed Mode (IMM) servers in the workflow designer to support server profile management and server storage operations. For more information, see Compute Tasks Matrix

  • Enhancements in Cisco Intersight Workload Optimizer (IWO) include ability to recommend scaling throughput capacity for Azure VMs, integration with Azure Monitor Log Analytics, support for Azure Site Recovery and Backup Volumes, improved Cloud Analytics, support for AWS Savings Plans, and License Policy Enhancements. For more information, see Intersight Workload Optimizer User Guide

  • Added new Cisco Security Advisories. For a complete list of advisories and more information, see Advisories

April 15

  • Added Cisco Intersight Workload Optimizer targets including Microsoft Hyper-V, Red Hat Enterprise Virtualization (RHEV), HPE OneView, Dell EMC SC Series, and HPE 3PAR. For more information, see the Intersight Workload Optimizer Target Configuration Guide

  • Added ability to query Smart License status information for HyperFlex clusters using Intersight API. For more information, see Intersight API

April 8

  • Added support for managing AppDynamics instances running on public cloud or SaaS directly from Intersight, without the need for Cisco Intersight Assist. For more information, see Intersight Workload Optimizer

April 1

  • Introducing Cisco Intersight Kubernetes Service (IKS), a fully curated, lightweight container management platform for delivering multi-cloud, production-grade, and upstream Kubernetes clusters. As part of this release:

    • Added the ability to deploy and manage the lifecycle of Kubernetes clusters in VMware ESXi environments.
    • Added support to install Cisco Intersight Workload Optimizer (IWO) agent Helm charts on IKS clusters for full-stack app visualization, Machine Learning (AIOps) based right-sizing, and intelligent top-down auto-scaling.

    For more information, see Cisco Intersight Kubernetes Service

  • Introducing Cisco Intersight Service for HashiCorp Terraform Service (IST) to deliver consistent infrastructure automation using IaC across hybrid clouds. This is a feature preview. For more information, see Intersight Service for HashiCorp Terraform

  • Added support for operating system installation on Intersight Managed Mode servers. For more information, see Operating System Installation Overview

March 29

  • Added support for inventory of virtual disks that are attached to a virtual machine. For more information, see Inventory of Virtual Disks

  • Added support for adding and removing virtual disks from a virtual machine. For more information, see Virtual Disk Operations

March 25

  • Enhancements in HyperFlex

    • Added the ability to upgrade HyperFlex Data Platform and VMware ESXi for Fabric Interconnect-attached HyperFlex clusters. For more information, see Upgrading Cisco HyperFlex Systems with Cisco Intersight
    • Added HyperFlex Data Platform 4.0(2e) support for HyperFlex cluster deployment and upgrade. For more information, see HyperFlex Cluster Management and Upgrading Cisco HyperFlex Systems with Cisco Intersight

  • Added support for excluding drives and storage controllers during firmware upgrades or downgrades of UCS C-Series and S-series standalone servers. For more information, see Upgrading UCS C-Series Standalone Servers Firmware and Upgrading UCS S-Series Standalone Servers Firmware

March 18

  • Added support for monitoring health and generating alarms for Intersight managed storage devices, adapters, and vNICs.

March 11

  • Added support for configuring and deploying the Syslog policy to collect logs on the remote syslog servers. For more information, see Syslog Policy in Server Policies

March 5

  • Added support to the storage controller inventory operations that include changing the physical drive state, removing the unused virtual drive, and importing or clearing the foreign configuration. For more information, see Server Inventory View

March 4

  • Support for Hitachi Virtual Storage Platform to automate storage and virtualization tasks, and view inventory information is now Generally Available. For more information, see Intersight Orchestrator and Intersight Assist

  • Ability to invoke web APIs via HTTP or HTTPS tasks to automate operations on the endpoints, added as Targets, in Intersight is now Generally Available. For more information, see Executors – Invoke Web API Request

  • Enhancements to the Intersight Managed Mode Policies

    • Added support for creating a Certificate Management Policy and associating the policy with a server profile. For more information, see Server Policies

    • Added support for configuring and deploying the SNMP Policy to manage and monitor the network devices. For more information, see SNMP Policy in Domain Policies

February 18

  • Added the ability to upgrade server firmware for HyperFlex Edge clusters. For more information, see Upgrading Cisco HyperFlex Edge Systems

  • Added support for power actions on virtual machines and ESXi host objects. For more information, see General Information on Virtual Machines

  • Added support for access to VMware virtual machines console through VMware Remote Console (VMRC) protocol.

  • Added support for configuring and deploying the Virtual Media Policy to map and mount virtual media images on the Intersight Managed Fabric Interconnect-attached servers. For more information, see Creating a Virtual Media Policy

February 12

  • All Intersight Managed Mode features are now in Early Availability. Enhancements to the Fabric Interconnect-attached devices include:

    • Capabilities
      • Introducing Device Console, an application running on the Fabric Interconnects, to allow monitoring device health and their connection status to Intersight. For more information, see Device Console
    • Domain Policies
      • Added support for configuring the MAC address aging time using Switch Control Policy. For more information, see Creating a Switch Control Policy
    • Server Policies
      • Added support for static addressing as part of the LAN Connectivity and SAN Connectivity policies. For more information, see Server Policies and Server Profiles
      • Added support for selecting and importing the default configurations to an Ethernet Adapter Policy or a Fibre Channel Adapter Policy. For more information, see Creating an Ethernet Adapter Policy and Creating a Fibre Channel Adapter Policy
      • Added support for viewing the actual boot order of the Intersight managed servers in the Server Inventory View tab. For more information, see Server Inventory View
      • Added support for enabling iSCSI boot on adapters. For more information, see Server Policies
      • Added support for applying QoS policy on the vNIC and vHBA policies. For more information, see Creating an Ethernet QoS Policy and Creating a Fibre Channel QoS Policy
  • Added Task Designer for creating tasks that make Intersight API and REST API calls to external targets that can be reached from Intersight, either directly or through device connectors. For more information, see Task Designer

February 4

  • Enhancements for Intersight managed devices

    • Added support for configuring and deploying the Syslog Policy on Intersight managed Fabric Interconnect-attached domains. For more information, see Syslog Policy in Domain Policies
    • Added support for monitoring the health and generating alarms for Intersight managed Fabric Interconnects, servers, and chassis
  • Added the ability to provide capacity recommendations for HyperFlex Clusters. For more information, see HyperFlex Capacity Planning
  • Added new Cisco Security Advisories. For a complete list of advisories and more information, see Advisories

January 21

  • Added support to access the TPM inventory details from a claimed device in Intersight Managed FI-attached servers. For information, see Server Inventory View
  • Added ability to disable the tech support bundle collection. For more information, see Tech Support Bundle Collection

January 14

  • Enhancements for Intersight managed Fabric Interconnects

    • Added support for excluding Fabric Interconnect traffic evacuation during upgrade of Intersight managed Fabric Interconnects. For more information, see Upgrading Fabric Interconnect Firmware
    • Added support for configuring a port as an appliance port to allow NFS storage to connect directly with Intersight managed Fabric Interconnects. For more information, see Domain Policies and Creating a Port Policy
  • Introducing new external witness support for HyperFlex Edge 2-Node Clusters. This feature increases cluster availability and flexibility for remote sites. For more information, see Configuring Device Connector

January 7

  • Ability to launch Virtual KVM and Tunneled vKVM directly from Cisco Intersight using SSO authentication for servers running with firmware version 4.1(3a) or later releases. For more information, see Launch Virtual KVM and Launch Tunneled Virtual KVM
  • Enhancements in HyperFlex Data Platform 4.5 Release
    • Ability to configure N:1 Replication of HyperFlex Edge clusters from Intersight. For more information, see N:1 Replication for HyperFlex Edge Clusters
    • Added HyperFlex Data Platform 4.5(1a) support for HyperFlex cluster deployment (FI and Edge) and upgrade of HyperFlex Edge clusters. For more information, see HyperFlex Cluster Management and Upgrading Cisco HyperFlex Systems with Cisco Intersight
    • Introducing the ability to run pre-defined health checks on HyperFlex clusters and view granular details about the health of HyperFlex clusters. For more information, see HyperFlex Health Check
